column4: i have installed the latest gnome 2.10, and i make use of the international characters. I noticed the system changed the old us-international, so this time i have selected us with dead keys. However, it does not seem to work like us international, what could be wrong?
it might be different my problem
i am not using a french layout along with an us
and it accepts the configuration as opposed to him/her
maybe, but that bug is bigger than it looks
the layout i chose us with deadkeys has more than 2 chars per key, how can you select the other two?
i have not found anything like that on google, that may solve my problem
there's a fix in http://bugzilla.ubuntu.com/show_bug.cgi?id=15372
wow, awsome let me check
i might have overlooked it, but it seems that their problem is mainly switching from one language to another.
did you try using the 'alt gr' key?
i do not understand very well that?
i thought it was just to change from one language to another
you can use alt-gr to get the other characters on each key
what is gr?
caonex: see your space bar?  big rectangular key at the bottom?  what's to its right?
an alt key.
use it to get the other characters
oh that means right alt
i tried that already
i kept thinking it was alt + something else
